definition: to recruit/to provoke/to beckon/to incur/to infect/contagious/a move (chess)/a maneuver/device/trick/to confess

to draw (e.g. a bow)/to pull/to stretch sth/to extend/to lengthen/to involve or implicate in/to attract/to lead/to guide/to leave/to provide evidence or justification for/old unit of distance equal to 10 丈[zhang4], one-thirtieth of a km or 33.33 meters

sentences.english: So to not to greedy butterfly, only small bees busy all day.
sentences.chinese: 所以招引不來貪心的蝴蝶，只有小蜜蜂整日的忙碌着。

sentences.english: The smell of the food might attract dangerous animals to our campsite.
sentences.chinese: 食物的氣味還可能會招引危險的動物到我們的營地來。

sentences.english: The light attracted a lot of insects.
A clean (and dry) set of BDU's is a magnet for mud and rain.
sentences.chinese: 乾淨的野戰制服是招引泥漿與雨水的磁石。

sentences.english: Tarati beckons the user to touch someone without physically touching a single key.
sentences.chinese: 德拉蒂招引用戶觸摸別人身體沒有觸及一個關鍵。

sentences.english: Success can attract friends, frustration can be tested.
sentences.chinese: 成功可招引朋友，挫敗可考驗朋友。

sentences.english: This is the pureness of innocence and the attraction by some distant divinity.
sentences.chinese: 是未經時的純粹，也是遙遠神性的招引。

sentences.english: Stephen used a highly successful come-on when she sold her house.
sentences.chinese: 斯蒂芬出售她的房子時招引買主的手法十分高超。

definition: to take in/to absorb/to admit/to accept

to double/to redouble/to increase many times over/to multiply by a factor/multiplication
